abstracts.cdata!:
This paper is an environmental
            assessment process study of the Private Sector
            Infrastructure Development Project for Sri Lanka.  The
            project seeks to promote significant participation of the
            private sector in the ownership, operation and maintenance
            of infrastructure facilities by establishing a facility to
            retail long-term subordinated debt.  It is intended to act
            as a catalyst to encourage private sector investment.
            Project sponsors would prepare individual sub-projects -
            which are not covered in this report.  The paper evaluates
            the process for reviewing the environmental acceptability of
            the sub-projects both by the government of Sri Lanka and by
            the International Development Association (IDA).  It details
            the necessary steps toward preparing an Environmental
            Assessment and the ideal approval process.
